PHES Parents as Teachers have openings!

What is Parents as Teachers? Parents as Teachers (PAT) serves families who are expecting a child or have children under the age of kindergarten entry. A trained parent educator provides home visits with families to promote early learning, knowledge, and understanding of child development and assist in building a partnership between families, schools and community resources.

This evidence-based early childhood program is designed to offer regularly scheduled family personal visits, annual developmental screenings, monthly group connections and access to a network of resources. Together, these four components of PAT support school readiness and provide families, schools, and communities the guidance they need to ensure children are able to reach their full potential.

If interested call 417-267-2271

--
Stacy Burdette

Pleasant Hope Elementary Pre-K Teacher

post_text:
The Pleasant Hope School District will be screening students for 2017-18 Kindergarten class on May 4-5, 2017. Screenings will take place at PHES during the school day. All families must pre-register by calling the school office at 417-267-2277 to reserve a time. Students must be five years of age by July 31, 2017. A parent or guardian must accompany their student to the screening, which will last about one hour. Please bring the following: Birth Certificate (copy for proof of age), Immunization Record, Proof of Residency (ie: current utility bill), Custody Papers (if applicable).

ALSO, we invite you to attend our Kindergarten Transition Day on May 3rd at 9am! During this time you and your child will meet the kindergarten teachers, tour the school, and even ride a school bus! Please let us know if you are planning to attend when you call to schedule for registration and screening. We look forward to meeting you!
